  14. (**************************************************************************)

  16. (** Extensible buffers.

  18.    This module implements buffers that automatically expand
  19.    as necessary.  It provides accumulative concatenation of strings
  20.    in linear time (instead of quadratic time when strings are
  21.    concatenated pairwise). For example:

  23. {[
  24.      let concat_strings ss =
  25.        let b = Buffer.create 16 in
  26.          List.iter (Buffer.add_string b) ss;
  27.          Buffer.contents b

  29. ]}

  31. *)

  33. (** {b Unsynchronized accesses} *)

  35. [@@@alert unsynchronized_access
  36.     "Unsynchronized accesses to buffers are a programming error."
  37. ]

  39. (**
  40.     Unsynchronized accesses to a buffer may lead to an invalid buffer state.
  41.     Thus, concurrent accesses to a buffer must be synchronized (for instance
  42.     with a {!Mutex.t}).
  43. *)

  45. ‌type t
  46. (** The abstract type of buffers. *)

  48. ‌val create : int -> t
  49. (** [create n] returns a fresh buffer, initially empty.
  50.    The [n] parameter is the initial size of the internal byte sequence
  51.    that holds the buffer contents. That byte sequence is automatically
  52.    reallocated when more than [n] characters are stored in the buffer,
  53.    but shrinks back to [n] characters when [reset] is called.
  54.    For best performance, [n] should be of the same order of magnitude
  55.    as the number of characters that are expected to be stored in
  56.    the buffer (for instance, 80 for a buffer that holds one output
  57.    line).  Nothing bad will happen if the buffer grows beyond that
  58.    limit, however. In doubt, take [n = 16] for instance.
  59.    If [n] is not between 1 and {!Sys.max_string_length}, it will
  60.    be clipped to that interval. *)

  62. ‌val contents : t -> string
  63. (** Return a copy of the current contents of the buffer.
  64.     The buffer itself is unchanged. *)

  66. ‌val to_bytes : t -> bytes
  67. (** Return a copy of the current contents of the buffer.
  68.     The buffer itself is unchanged.
  69.     @since 4.02 *)

  71. ‌val sub : t -> int -> int -> string
  72. (** [Buffer.sub b off len] returns a copy of [len] bytes from the
  73.     current contents of the buffer [b], starting at offset [off].
  74.     @raise Invalid_argument if [off] and [len] do not designate a valid
  75.     range of [b]. *)

  77. ‌val blit : t -> int -> bytes -> int -> int -> unit
  78. (** [Buffer.blit src srcoff dst dstoff len] copies [len] characters from
  79.    the current contents of the buffer [src], starting at offset [srcoff]
  80.    to [dst], starting at character [dstoff].
  81.    @raise Invalid_argument if [srcoff] and [len] do not designate a valid
  82.    range of [src], or if [dstoff] and [len] do not designate a valid
  83.    range of [dst].
  84.    @since 3.11.2
  85. *)

  87. ‌val nth : t -> int -> char
  88. (** Get the n-th character of the buffer.
  89.     @raise Invalid_argument if
  90.     index out of bounds *)

  92. ‌val length : t -> int
  93. (** Return the number of characters currently contained in the buffer. *)

  95. ‌val clear : t -> unit
  96. (** Empty the buffer. *)

  98. ‌val reset : t -> unit
  99. (** Empty the buffer and deallocate the internal byte sequence holding the
  100.    buffer contents, replacing it with the initial internal byte sequence
  101.    of length [n] that was allocated by {!Buffer.create} [n].
  102.    For long-lived buffers that may have grown a lot, [reset] allows
  103.    faster reclamation of the space used by the buffer. *)

  105. ‌val output_buffer : out_channel -> t -> unit
  106. (** [output_buffer oc b] writes the current contents of buffer [b]
  107.    on the output channel [oc]. *)

  109. ‌val truncate : t -> int -> unit
  110. (** [truncate b len] truncates the length of [b] to [len]
  111.   Note: the internal byte sequence is not shortened.
  112.   @raise Invalid_argument if [len < 0] or [len > length b].
  113.   @since 4.05 *)

  115. (** {1 Appending} *)

  117. (** Note: all [add_*] operations can raise [Failure] if the internal byte
  118.     sequence of the buffer would need to grow beyond {!Sys.max_string_length}.
  119. *)

  121. ‌val add_char : t -> char -> unit
  122. (** [add_char b c] appends the character [c] at the end of buffer [b]. *)

  124. ‌val add_utf_8_uchar : t -> Uchar.t -> unit
  125. (** [add_utf_8_uchar b u] appends the {{:https://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc3629}
  126.     UTF-8} encoding of [u] at the end of buffer [b].

  128.     @since 4.06 *)

  130. ‌val add_utf_16le_uchar : t -> Uchar.t -> unit
  131. (** [add_utf_16le_uchar b u] appends the
  132.     {{:https://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc2781}UTF-16LE} encoding of [u]
  133.     at the end of buffer [b].

  135.     @since 4.06 *)

  137. ‌val add_utf_16be_uchar : t -> Uchar.t -> unit
  138. (** [add_utf_16be_uchar b u] appends the
  139.     {{:https://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc2781}UTF-16BE} encoding of [u]
  140.     at the end of buffer [b].

  142.     @since 4.06 *)

  144. ‌val add_string : t -> string -> unit
  145. (** [add_string b s] appends the string [s] at the end of buffer [b]. *)

  147. ‌val add_bytes : t -> bytes -> unit
  148. (** [add_bytes b s] appends the byte sequence [s] at the end of buffer [b].
  149.     @since 4.02 *)

  151. ‌val add_substring : t -> string -> int -> int -> unit
  152. (** [add_substring b s ofs len] takes [len] characters from offset
  153.    [ofs] in string [s] and appends them at the end of buffer [b].

  155.     @raise Invalid_argument if [ofs] and [len] do not designate a valid
  156.     range of [s]. *)

  158. ‌val add_subbytes : t -> bytes -> int -> int -> unit
  159. (** [add_subbytes b s ofs len] takes [len] characters from offset
  160.     [ofs] in byte sequence [s] and appends them at the end of buffer [b].

  162.     @raise Invalid_argument if [ofs] and [len] do not designate a valid
  163.     range of [s].

  165.     @since 4.02 *)

  167. ‌val add_substitute : t -> (string -> string) -> string -> unit
  168. (** [add_substitute b f s] appends the string pattern [s] at the end
  169.    of buffer [b] with substitution.
  170.    The substitution process looks for variables into
  171.    the pattern and substitutes each variable name by its value, as
  172.    obtained by applying the mapping [f] to the variable name. Inside the
  173.    string pattern, a variable name immediately follows a non-escaped
  174.    [$] character and is one of the following:
  175.    - a non empty sequence of alphanumeric or [_] characters,
  176.    - an arbitrary sequence of characters enclosed by a pair of
  177.    matching parentheses or curly brackets.
  178.    An escaped [$] character is a [$] that immediately follows a backslash
  179.    character; it then stands for a plain [$].
  180.    @raise Not_found if the closing character of a parenthesized variable
  181.    cannot be found. *)

  183. ‌val add_buffer : t -> t -> unit
  184. (** [add_buffer b1 b2] appends the current contents of buffer [b2]
  185.    at the end of buffer [b1].  [b2] is not modified. *)

  187. ‌val add_channel : t -> in_channel -> int -> unit
  188. (** [add_channel b ic n] reads at most [n] characters from the
  189.    input channel [ic] and stores them at the end of buffer [b].
  190.    @raise End_of_file if the channel contains fewer than [n]
  191.    characters. In this case, the characters are still added to
  192.    the buffer, so as to avoid loss of data.

  194.    @raise Invalid_argument if [len < 0] or [len > Sys.max_string_length].
  195. *)

  197. (** {1 Buffers and Sequences} *)

  199. ‌val to_seq : t -> char Seq.t
  200. (** Iterate on the buffer, in increasing order.

  202.     The behavior is not specified if the buffer is modified during iteration.
  203.     @since 4.07 *)

  205. ‌val to_seqi : t -> (int * char) Seq.t
  206. (** Iterate on the buffer, in increasing order, yielding indices along chars.

  208.     The behavior is not specified if the buffer is modified during iteration.
  209.     @since 4.07 *)

  211. ‌val add_seq : t -> char Seq.t -> unit
  212. (** Add chars to the buffer
  213.     @since 4.07 *)

  215. ‌val of_seq : char Seq.t -> t
  216. (** Create a buffer from the generator
  217.     @since 4.07 *)

  219. (** {1 Binary encoding of integers} *)

  221. (** The functions in this section append binary encodings of integers
  222.     to buffers.

  224.     Little-endian (resp. big-endian) encoding means that least
  225.     (resp. most) significant bytes are stored first.  Big-endian is
  226.     also known as network byte order.  Native-endian encoding is
  227.     either little-endian or big-endian depending on {!Sys.big_endian}.

  229.     32-bit and 64-bit integers are represented by the [int32] and
  230.     [int64] types, which can be interpreted either as signed or
  231.     unsigned numbers.

  233.     8-bit and 16-bit integers are represented by the [int] type,
  234.     which has more bits than the binary encoding.  Functions that
  235.     encode these values truncate their inputs to their least
  236.     significant bytes.
  237. *)

  239. ‌val add_uint8 : t -> int -> unit
  240. (** [add_uint8 b i] appends a binary unsigned 8-bit integer [i] to
  241.     [b].
  242.     @since 4.08
  243. *)

  245. ‌val add_int8 : t -> int -> unit
  246. (** [add_int8 b i] appends a binary signed 8-bit integer [i] to
  247.     [b].
  248.     @since 4.08
  249. *)

  251. ‌val add_uint16_ne : t -> int -> unit
  252. (** [add_uint16_ne b i] appends a binary native-endian unsigned 16-bit
  253.     integer [i] to [b].
  254.     @since 4.08
  255. *)

  257. ‌val add_uint16_be : t -> int -> unit
  258. (** [add_uint16_be b i] appends a binary big-endian unsigned 16-bit
  259.     integer [i] to [b].
  260.     @since 4.08
  261. *)

  263. ‌val add_uint16_le : t -> int -> unit
  264. (** [add_uint16_le b i] appends a binary little-endian unsigned 16-bit
  265.     integer [i] to [b].
  266.     @since 4.08
  267. *)

  269. ‌val add_int16_ne : t -> int -> unit
  270. (** [add_int16_ne b i] appends a binary native-endian signed 16-bit
  271.     integer [i] to [b].
  272.     @since 4.08
  273. *)

  275. ‌val add_int16_be : t -> int -> unit
  276. (** [add_int16_be b i] appends a binary big-endian signed 16-bit
  277.     integer [i] to [b].
  278.     @since 4.08
  279. *)

  281. ‌val add_int16_le : t -> int -> unit
  282. (** [add_int16_le b i] appends a binary little-endian signed 16-bit
  283.     integer [i] to [b].
  284.     @since 4.08
  285. *)

  287. ‌val add_int32_ne : t -> int32 -> unit
  288. (** [add_int32_ne b i] appends a binary native-endian 32-bit integer
  289.     [i] to [b].
  290.     @since 4.08
  291. *)

  293. ‌val add_int32_be : t -> int32 -> unit
  294. (** [add_int32_be b i] appends a binary big-endian 32-bit integer
  295.     [i] to [b].
  296.     @since 4.08
  297. *)

  299. ‌val add_int32_le : t -> int32 -> unit
  300. (** [add_int32_le b i] appends a binary little-endian 32-bit integer
  301.     [i] to [b].
  302.     @since 4.08
  303. *)

  305. ‌val add_int64_ne  : t -> int64 -> unit
  306. (** [add_int64_ne b i] appends a binary native-endian 64-bit integer
  307.     [i] to [b].
  308.     @since 4.08
  309. *)

  311. ‌val add_int64_be : t -> int64 -> unit
  312. (** [add_int64_be b i] appends a binary big-endian 64-bit integer
  313.     [i] to [b].
  314.     @since 4.08
  315. *)

  317. ‌val add_int64_le : t -> int64 -> unit
  318. (** [add_int64_ne b i] appends a binary little-endian 64-bit integer
  319.     [i] to [b].
  320.     @since 4.08
  321. *)
